cyclone.name: KAREN
cyclone.current_location: about 360 miles SSE of St. Croix
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northwest tonight and north on Tuesday, passing very near or over the U.S. Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico before moving northward into the western Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or over the U.S. Virgin Islands / Puerto Rico

weather_observation.watch_coast: U.S. Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico (including Vieques and Culebra), British Virgin Islands
weather_observation.warning_coast: Grenada and its dependencies, St. Vincent and the Grenadines
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern Caribbean from Windward Islands northward to Puerto Rico and the U.S./British Virgin Islands
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible – isolated totals up to 6 inches forecast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained near 40 mph with higher gusts) possible Tuesday, diminishing late Tuesday night.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected beyond minor coastal run-up
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with locally higher amounts up to 6 inches; risk of flash flooding and mudslides.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rapidly deteriorating sea state and hazardous marine conditions affecting vessel operations and harbor approaches.
